Package com.cyberfront.crdt.sample.simulation

Class MessageRouter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyberfront.crdt.sample.simulation.MessageRouter

  • public class MessageRouter
extends java.lang.Object
    The MessageRouter class is responsible for message delivery to the correct node in the distributed environment. Messages are inserted into the message priority queue asynchronously

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger
      A logger for writing to the local log output.
      private java.util.PriorityQueue<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> messages
      A priority queue ordered byt message time stamp
      private long timestamp
      Timestamp of the most recent message delivery, or the current message being delivered and processed.

      • deliverNextMessage

        public java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> deliverNextMessage​(java.lang.Double pReject)
        Deliver the next message with a probability the owning node will reject the update the message contains. Rejections are for Create, Update and Delete operations, though in practice, Creates are only performed on the owning node, so those don't actually get rejected.
        Parameters:
        pReject - Probability the owning node will reject the message payload
        Returns:
        The collection of messages to forward to other nodes in response to handling the given message and its embedded operation

      • add

        public void add​(java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> messages)
        Add a collection of messages to the message queue.
        Parameters:
        messages - the collection of messages to add to the message queue
